product.longDescription: Very upright, easy to grow, and adaptable to all seasons. Attractive, dark-green savoyed leaves that blanch at the center. This variety is extremely slow to bolt and exceptionally tipburn tolerant. A cross between romaine and iceberg, with good weight and crunch for its size. Great in salad mix or marketed as mini heads. NOTE: Days to maturity will vary depending on your target weight and growing practices, but you can expect a range of 35–45 days for hydroponically grown, full-size heads. High resistance to downy mildew races EU 17, 18, 22, 24, 25, 29, 30, 33, 35, 37; Nasonovia ribisnigri aphid; and intermediate resistance to lettuce mosaic virus. MT0-30. NOP-compliant pelleted seed. Avg. 12,500 seeds/lb. Packet: 250 seeds.
product.shortDescription: Open mini romaine with crunchy texture.
